document.docAuthor: Chan, Benny K. K., Kolbasov, Gregory A., Hirose, Mamiko, Mezaki, T. & Suwa, R.
document.docOrigin: Journal of Natural History (J. Nat. Hist.) 48 (25 - 26)
document.masterDocTitle: Biodiversity and biogeography of the coral boring barnacles of the genus Berndtia (Cirripedia: Acrothoracica) in the West Pacific, with description of three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Biodiversity and biogeography of the coral boring barnacles of the genus Berndtia (Cirripedia: Acrothoracica) in the West Pacific, with description of three new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Syntype specimen. No. 57 Seto Marine Laboratory Collection (see Figure 13 ). CEL- Acro 123, 10 specimens , bored in the coral
Lepastrea
purpurea , He Ping
Island, NE coast, Taiwan ,
19 May 2010
, depth
10 m
.
CEL-Acro-OK6, three specimens , bored in the coral
Lepastrea
purpurea , Zanpa
, Okinawa , Japan
31 May 2010
, depth
10m
.
CEL-Acro-OK7, seven specimens , same data as CEL-Acro-OK6. CEL-Acro-JAcro9, 10 specimens , bored in the coral
Lepastrea
purpurea , Tanabe Bay
, Wakayama , Japan ,
1 Aug 2010
. CEL- Acro-HK01, 10 specimens , bored in coral
Lepastrea purpurea
, Nov , 2011
.

Female. Operculum wide, oval shaped, composed of a pair of opercular bars. When alive, outer surfaces of the opercular bars have three paired blue-coloured stripshaped areas (three on each bar), distributed at the two ends and the middle portion. The remaining parts of the outer surface of the opercular bar are black in colour. Outer surfaces of the opercular bars with dense, numerous spherical nodules, without setae, lateral margins with simple and bifid teeth. The posterior lobes of operculum not protruded, their posterior margins straight. External surface of mantle sac with simple, bifid and trifid teeth. Thorax with two small conical processes on ventral side. Bore in the coral
Lepastrea purpurea
.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 13.
Berndtia purpurea
(type specimen, Seto Marine Laboratory No. 39). (A) Label of type of
B . purpurea
in Seto Marine Laboratory, showing type and syntypes were collected from both Lepastrea and
Psammocora
corals; (B) lateral view of female; (C) drawing of lateral view of female and opercular bars in Hiro, 1939; (D) magnified view of posterior lobe of operculum (from rectangle area in ‘B’), showing straight posterior margin. Abbreviations: cc – comb collar, ob – opercular bar, pl – posterior lobe of operculum, pm – posterior margin of posterior lobe.

Figure 14.
Berndtia purpurea
. Scanning electron microscopy of mantle sac structures, female. (A) Opercular area, upper view; (B) small posterior lobe and comb collar; (C) protrusions of comb collar; (D) lateral margin of the opercular bar showing truncated teeth and multifid scales; (E) outer surface of opercular bar showing rounded nodules; (F) occludent margins of opercular bars showing teeth and simple setae; (G) lateral region of opercular area, showing setae, simple teeth and massive multifid scales; (H) multifid scales on lateral surface of mantle

subSubSection.paragraph: Description (based on our own material collected from the type locality and type specimen)

sac; (I) large single teeth on mantle sac and massive multifid scales; (J) lateral view of upper half of mantle sac; (K) lateral view of posterior part of opercular area, showing small posterior lobe, note the straight posterior margin of posterior lobe; (L) surface of mantle sac showing feeble multifid scales and mantle teeth. Abbreviations: cc – comb collar, ob – opercular bars, pl – posterior lobe. Scale bars in μm.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 15.
Berndtia purpurea
. Light microscopy of opercular area, mouth parts and cirri. A. Posterior lobes of operculum, note straight posterior margin (upper). B. Posterior end of opercular bar. C. Mouth cirrus. D. Intermediate annuli of anterior ramus of terminal cirrus II. E. Distal end of mandibular palp. F. Mandible. G. Maxillule. H. Maxillae. Abbreviations: ar – anterior ramus, ba – basis, cc – comb collar, ob – opercular bar, pl – posterior lobe, pr – posterior ramus. Scale bars in μm.

Figure 16.
Berndtia purpurea
. Scanning electron microscopy of mouth parts. (A) Oral cone, lateral view, note dorsal process ( dp ) of labrum; (B) labrum, anterior view; (C) distal end of mandibular palp; D. Simple and serrate setae of mandibular palp. E. Mandible. F. Maxillule. G. Maxillae, inner surface. H. Serrate setae of maxilla. Abbreviations: dp – dorsal process of labrum, la – labrum, mc – mouth cirri, mp – mandibular palp. Scale bars in μm.

Figure 17.
Berndtia purpurea
. Scanning electron microscopy of cirri. (A) Mouth cirrus, lateral view; (B) serrate and thin setae on basis and outer (posterior) ramus of mouth cirrus; (C) mouth cirrus, lateral view; (D) magnified view of inner (anterior) and outer (posterior) rami of mouth cirrus; (E) serrate setae of anterior ramus of mouth cirrus; (F) thorax with cluster of terminal cirri; (G) magnified view of distal annuli of terminal cirri III and IV. H. Intermediate annuli of anterior ramus of cirrus VI. Abbreviations: ar – anterior ramus, cp – conical processes of thorax, pr – posterior ramus. Scale bars in μm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Dwarf males were found on the mantle sac of the female and on wall of burrow ( Figure 2C , 3C ). Males elongated, tadpole shaped, and with a small terminal ampulla on long stalk at the posterior end. Some opaque reddish purple granules were found at the middle of the elongated body, believed to be remnants of the cypris eyes, attachment of cypris antennules without stalk ( Figure 22C ).

Bore in the coral
Lepastrea purpurea
and one specimen boring in
Montipora
coral in the present study.

Taiwan , Japan : Okinawa , Kochi and Wakayama
.

Utinomi (1950b) , published a book chapter in Japanese on 1 April 1950 (see Poore, 2013), and identified
Berndtia purpurea
from Wakayama , Japan and erected a new subfamily, new genus and species to accommodate it. Utinomi (1950a) published a paper in English on 25 July 1950 , describing
Berndtia purpurea
from both Lepastrea and
Psammocora
corals; he believed the specimens in these two types of corals were the same species. Utinomi (1957) stated the type specimens of
Berndtia purpurea
to be in the collection of the Seto Marine Laboratory, Wakayama , Japan , but did not mention the coral host of the types ( Figure 13A ). In the present study, we examined the type specimen of
Berndtia purpurea
in Wakayama but the information of the type indicated the type and syntypes were collected from both Lepastrea and
Psammocora
corals ( Figure 13A ). There exists no information regarding the coral host of the type on the specimen label. When examining the external morphology of the type specimen, we found that the posterior lobe of the operculum of the type had a straight posterior margin which fits the morphology of our specimens collected from
Lepastrea purpurea
from the type locality ( Wakayama ; Figure 13 ). We therefore, conclude the type specimens of
Berndtia purpurea
was collected from the coral
Lepastrea purpurea
but not
Psammocora profundacella
.
